properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Born (1826) in Washington, PA to a free mother and formerly enslaved father

properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Migrates (1840) to Cincinnati, OH, to apprentice under uncle, a barber, and attend school

properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Works on river steamboat (~1841-1842)

properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Settles in Muscatine (1842), works as a barber and entreneur

properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Purchases Conservator and moves to Chicago to edit the paper (~1884-1890)

properties.Name: Alexander Clark
properties.info: Moves to Liberia as U.S. Minister (1890); dies 1891; body returned to Muscatine for burial.

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Born (1822) enslaved in Tyler Co., VA; inherited by owner's daughter (Rachel Cheadle, nee Ankrom) and at age 3 taken by her to OH (1825)
properties.description: on land now know as the Old County Infirmary Farm, Owned by Ankroms, willed to owner's daughter Rachel https://www.mapofus.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/WV-county.jpg

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Remains in Cheadle household (1825-1842)
properties.description: Rachel Cheadle, nee Ankrom, and Patrick Cheadle's household

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Migrates with Cheadles to Marion, IA (1842-1843)
properties.description: Cheadle household

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Moves to Iowa City (1843) where she works for family of E. C. Lyon; meets and marries Alexander Clark (1848); moves to Muscatine, IA
properties.description: Works for E. C. Lyon, Esq.

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Precarious freedom until Cheadles sign manumission papers in 1851
properties.description: Marries Alexander Clark and moves to his home

properties.Name: Catherine Griffin Clark
properties.info: Resides in Muscatine with her family until her death (1879)

properties.Name: Rebecca Darnes Clark Howard
properties.info: Born (1810)in PA to free parents; resides in Washington, PA where she marries and has five children; husband dies there 1851
properties.description: Born free to formerly enslaved parents; marries John Clark, who dies in 1851; 1863 moves to her son, Alexander Clark's home community in Muscatine

properties.Name: Rebecca Darnes Clark Howard
properties.info: Migrates (1863) to Muscatine, IA, to home of son Alexander
properties.description: Widowed; lives with son

properties.Name: Rebecca Darnes Clark Howard
properties.info: Moves to Iowa City, IA prior to 1865 marriage to James Howard
properties.description: Lives with husband John Howard, '68 delegate

properties.Name: Rebecca Darnes Clark Howard
properties.info: Dies (1887) at Keokuk home of her daughter, Susan Clark Holly.
properties.description: Dies at home of her grandaughter, Susan Clark Holly

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Born 1854 to free father and manumitted mother
properties.description: Daughter of Alexander and Catherine Clark

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Moves (1877) to Champaign, IL where husband serves AME congregation
properties.description: Husband Rec. Richard Holly posted at Champaign

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Moves (1880) to Davenport, where husband serves AME congregation
properties.description: Husband's church posting

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Moves (1887) to Keokuk, where husband serves AME congregation
properties.description: Husband's church posting, grandmother lives with them

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Moves (1887) to Cedar Rapids, where husband serves AME congregation
properties.description: Husband's posting

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Moves (1901)to Waterloo, where husband serves AME congregation
properties.description: Husband's posting

properties.Name: Susan V. Clark Holly
properties.info: Dies in 1925 at home of niece, in Chicago
properties.description: Dies at home of her niece

properties.Name: Daniel Anderson
properties.info: Unknown birthdate in Frederick, MD; marries manumitted Ellen Anderson, her second husband

properties.Name: Daniel Anderson
properties.info: Migrates (1840) with thirteen Anderson family members to Muscatine, Iowa, with former owners of wife; dies 1856

properties.Name: Ellen Anderson nee Mathews
properties.info: Born (1791) enslaved to wealthy slaveowning family of Alexander Warfield
properties.description: born enslaved, lived in Alexander Warfield's household, manumitted 1812, married Edward Mathews, bears 7 children

properties.Name: Ellen Anderson nee Mathews
properties.info: Manumitted at age 22 (1812); remains in Warfield household until 3 Warfield men migrate to Muscatine; Ellen, her husband and children--15 people in total--migrate with Warfields to IA in 1840

properties.Name: Ellen Anderson nee Mathews
properties.info: Resides in Muscatine (1840) until her death (1883)
properties.description: First resides with David R. Warfield; married Daniel Anderson and by 1850 residing with Daniel in own household. Note we have data about changing households after Daniel's death.

properties.Name: Boling Bowser
properties.info: Born free (1828) in OH to free parents
properties.description: Mother born in Ohio.

properties.Name: Boling Bowser
properties.info: By 1855, he, his wife and son, and a friend, Migrate to Mt. Pleasant, Iowa
properties.description: residence at Jackson St. south of Green St.

properties.Name: Boling Bowser
properties.info: 1860, Migrates to Liberia with the help of the American Colonization Society

properties.Name: Benjamin Mathews
properties.info: Born ca. 1803 to enslaved mother in Frederick, MD
properties.description: born enslaved on A. O. Warfield plantation

properties.Name: Benjamin Mathews
properties.info: Manumitted (1812); remains in former owner's household (Warfield family) with mother, father, and siblings
properties.description: manumitted on A. O. Warfield plantation

properties.Name: Benjamin Mathews
properties.info: When 3 Warfield men migrate (1839) to Muscatine, he accompanies them as far as southern IL wher he stays for 1 year
properties.description: southern Illinois

properties.Name: Benjamin Mathews
properties.info: Moves (1840) to Warfield household in Muscatine, IA, joined by wife, children, and extended family

properties.Name: Hannah Virginia Mathews
properties.info: Born (1822) in Burlington, VT

properties.Name: Hannah Virginia Mathews
properties.info: By 1847, mgrates to Muscatine, IA and marries Benjamin Mathews

properties.Name: George Manly
properties.info: Born (1825)  in VA, status unclear; Migrates to Muscatine, IA by 1848 founding of AME church
properties.description: born enslaved

properties.Name: George Manly
properties.info: Resides in Muscatine until his 1891 death

properties.Name: Noah Tutt
properties.info: Apparently born free (1824) in Millersburg, KY; father, a free man, files his manumission deed in KY in 1832.

properties.Name: Noah Tutt
properties.info: Migrates (1832) with Akron, OH with family
properties.description: With father and family

properties.Name: Noah Tutt
properties.info: Migrates (1853) to Muscatine, IA, where he lived until his death (1918)

properties.Name: Minerva A. Barkshire Tutt
properties.info: Born (1836) enslaved in Boone Co., KY to manumitted father and enslaved mother
properties.description: born enslaved, owned either by Barkshire's heirs or Joseph Hawkins

properties.Name: Minerva A. Barkshire Tutt
properties.info: Surviving daughter of slaveowner (Nancy Hawkins) Migrates to Rising Sun, IND; manumits Minerva and other family members by 1848 and they Migrate to live with Hawkins in Rising Sun, IND.  On her death (1854) farm and household passes to Barkshire family; marries Noah Tutt
properties.description: With family and widow of former owner who manumitted her

properties.Name: Minerva A. Barkshire Tutt
properties.info: Migrates (1856) with husband to Muscatine, IA
properties.description: With Noah Tutt

properties.Name: Thomas Cook Motts
properties.info: Born free (1810) to Ellen, a free woman of color in Sharpsburg, MD
properties.description: Born to a free woman of color; marries Henrietta prior to 1838

properties.Name: Thomas Cook Motts
properties.info: Marries sometime before 1838; leaves to work on Ohio River; returns to find his enslaved wife deceased, his enslaved daughter in custody of his sister; unsucessfully attempts to buy his daughter's freedom; flees with daughter, brother and sister to Cincinnati

properties.Name: Thomas Cook Motts
properties.info: Migrates (1840) to Muscatine, IA; Marries twice more following death of spouse; dies unexpectedly while on a business trip to Cairo, IL.

properties.Name: Mahalia Sammons Motts
properties.info: Born (1825) to free parents in Nanticoke Hundreds, DEL

properties.Name: Mahalia Sammons Motts
properties.info: Migrates (1837) to Louisa Co., IA with two additional families of mixed-race people from DEL; marries Thomas Motts in 1848
properties.description: with family of origin

properties.Name: Mahalia Sammons Motts
properties.info: Resides in Muscatine, IA until her husband's death (1849-1866)
properties.description: With husband

properties.Name: Mahalia Sammons Motts Lindsey
properties.info: Remarries in 1866 and moves to Washington, IA (1866) until her 1898 death
properties.description: widowed, remarries

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: Born 1812 in Baltimore, MD, to what he described as a father who was part African American and part German, and an Irish mother; apparently learned the butchering trade form extended family members.

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: At age 22 (1834), travels west to Pittsburgh

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: Travels from PA to Louisville, KY

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: Travels from Louisville, KY to the Yellowstone area

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: In 1842, travels back east from Montana to Keokuk, IA, marries, and established his butchering business.
properties.description: Starts butchering business; common-law marriage with Harriet [?]

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: Migrates to Maryville, CA in 1852 as part of the gold rush, fails, Migrates to Sacremento and then San Francisco; his first wife (perhaps common-law) dies; he meets and marries Mary A. Jeffers Cowan, and with her runs a public house until 1855.
properties.description: Keeps a public house; legal marriage with Mary A. Jeffers Cowan

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: In 1855, he and his wife migrate back to Keokuk, IA
properties.description: Expands sucessful slaughterhouse and butchering business

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: Sometime after 1873, he and his wife migrate east to her home in Petersburg, VA; he lives there a few years, then travels west again.

properties.Name: John Hiner
properties.info: 1886, he returns to Keokuk where he dies, within days of his wife's passing in VA.
properties.description: Death and burial

properties.Name: Mary A. Jeffers Cowan Hiner
properties.info: Born 1822 to formerly enslaved Sylvia Jeffers, who worked as a laundress in Petersburg, VA.  In 1853 her mother successfully petitions the court to have the family declared white according to VA law.
properties.description: with family of origin

properties.Name: Mary A. Jeffers Cowan Hiner
properties.info: By 1854, has migrated west to San Francisco, marries John Hiner, runs a "public house;" holds $3000 of her own wealth.
properties.description: Runs a boarding house; meets & marries John Hiner

properties.Name: Mary A. Jeffers Cowan Hiner
properties.info: In 1855, she settles in Keokuk with John; among the wealthiest residents of the city, until their support of Emma Coger's 1874 segregation lawsuit leads to white boycotts of John's business.
properties.description: Moves to Keokuk with John Hiner

properties.Name: Mary A. Jeffers Cowan Hiner
properties.info: At an unknown date, she returns to Petersburg wher she dies shortly after John passes in Keokuk; she is buried in Petersburg, and her considerable real estate holdings pass to her surviving child, Nammoka.
properties.description: with family of origin
